info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL RALEIGH AND CENTRAL WYOMING COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Twin Falls State Park, or 7 miles northeast of Pineville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Pineville, Mullens, Mabscott, Sophia, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Coal City, Bradley, Shady Spring, Prosperity, Twin Falls State Park, Beaver, Daniels, Piney View, Stanaford, Lester, Rhodell, and Bolt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
